solution_line_template: He buys {eggplant_pounds} pounds of eggplants and {zucchini_pounds} pounds of zucchini so he buys {eggplant_pounds}+{zucchini_pounds} = <<{eggplant_pounds}+{zucchini_pounds}={produce_pounds}>>{produce_pounds} pounds of produce

These {produce_pounds} pounds are ${produce_price_per_pound} a pound for a total of {produce_pounds}*{produce_price_per_pound} = $<<{produce_pounds}*{produce_price_per_pound}={produce_cost}>>{produce_cost}

He needs {tomato_pounds} pounds of tomatoes that are ${tomato_price_per_pound} a pound for a total of {tomato_pounds}*{tomato_price_per_pound} = $<<{tomato_pounds}*{tomato_price_per_pound}={tomato_cost}>>{tomato_cost}

He needs {onion_pounds} pounds of onions that are ${onion_price_per_pound} a pound so that's {onion_pounds}*{onion_price_per_pound} = $<<{onion_pounds}*{onion_price_per_pound}={onion_cost}>>{onion_cost}

The basil is sold by the half-pound and he needs a full pound so that's {basil_price_per_half_pound}*{basil_half_pounds_needed} = $<<{basil_price_per_half_pound}*{basil_half_pounds_needed}={basil_cost}>>{basil_cost}

The eggplants and zucchinis cost ${produce_cost}, the tomatoes are ${tomato_cost}, the onions are ${onion_cost} and the basil is ${basil_cost} for a total of {produce_cost}+{tomato_cost}+{onion_cost}+{basil_cost} = $<<{produce_cost}+{tomato_cost}+{onion_cost}+{basil_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
This recipe makes {yield_quarts} quarts and the total price of the vegetables was ${total_cost} so each quart costs {total_cost}/{yield_quarts} = ${cost_per_quart}
